page.title: 11THE HARWICH REDOUBT FETE
page.content: THE REDOUBT FETE IS AN ANNUAL EVENT IN HARWICH.THE REDOUBT FETE COST 20p TO GET IN.THEY HAD SOME EXHIBITIONS WITH GUNS, UNIFORMS, HELMETS AND PHOTOGRAPHS ABOUT THE WAR.THERE WAS A STALL WHERE YOU HAD TO SMASH A KITCHEN UP.MOST OF THE STALLS WERE RAFFLES AND KNOCKING OBJECTS DOWN.THE SEA SCOUTS HELPED PEOPLE UP THE STAIRS AND SHOWED THE WAY AROUND.THERE WAS A PUNCH AND JUDY SHOW FOR THE LITTLE CHILDREN. THE WEATHER WAS QUITE GOOD AND THE FETE ATTRACTED A LOT OF PEOPLE. FOR THE MORE ACTIVE THERE WAS THE OPPORTUNITY TO SLIDE DOWN A DEATH SLIDE- NOBODY DIED! IN ADDITION THERE WAS A COCONUT SHY AND A STALL WHERE YOU HAD TO KICK FOOTBALLS AT POLITICIAN'S HEADS. FOR YOUNGER CHILDREN THERE WAS ALSO A ROUNDABOUT. THE MONEY RAISED AT THE FETE HELPS TO PAY FOR THE UPKEEP OF THE REDOUBT.
